intro: Hermbstaedtia nigrescens, commonly known as the blackening herbmbstaedtia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, with a distinctive calyx that turns black as the flower matures. It is often found in moist, shaded environments in the understory of tropical forests.
